page.title: 19Rivers.
page.content: The principal river of the area is the {River Wid}which flows roughly from south-west to north-east. It is not a large river - usually no more than a metre or so deep but it does form a natural boundary in the area. There is only one small, narrow road bridge across the river - near the sewage works to the south of Ingatestone. The river is in its middle course and meanders across the gently undulating countryside. The valley is gently sloping and there is little evidence of the development of any substantial flood plain. Near the sewage works there is a small area of water meadow where horses are grazed; this rough pasture provides a contrast with the intensively used farmland elsewhere. A number of small tributaries flow into the River Wid.
